storyName: At the End of the Night
storyInfo: As the flames return amidst song, Loughshinny prevails over the dark mist as well as her hesitant heart and enters the purple fire, transforming the purple shade of death into an orange hue of rebirth. From the firelight the red dragon comes back to life, sending the darkness away.

attributes.content: Your Highness, The Singer has just sent word that The Elocutionist and the rest have taken Loughshinny. They are on their way to County Hillock.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: I see.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: He only sent news after our troops left and 'The Leader' had already set out for County Hillock. He seemed to want to avoid offending The Elocutionist and his group, but also to avoid accusations of concealing information.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: What should we do with him?
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: Dublinn has never needed him to be our eyes. No one is counting on him for this.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: My utmost apologies. I take full responsibility. I assumed they were heading towards County Hillock on orders, and never imagined they'd dare to take Loughshinny.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: But they haven't gotten far, so we can still catch up if we set off now—
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: Your Highness, I bring news from your sister. She hopes you can curb The Elocutionist and his men from acting rashly, and bring her back.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: She said that herself?
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: That's right.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: I'll mobilize the troops at once—
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: Hold on.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Your Highness, we should stop them as soon as possible.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: Also: 'I don't want to go to County Hillock'. Straight from the dragon's mouth.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: If that is truly her desire, then she ought to realize it with her own hands.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: It would be no difficult task with her flames. Has she not already sentenced quite a few to death in the name of The Leader?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Tell her this: if that is what she wants, she can do it herself—
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: No, there's no need for even that.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Your Highness, if I may be so bold, she is your—
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: My sister?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: The giant dragon flaps its steel wings, stirring up a flaming vortex, but Loughshinny does not waver.
She stabs her spear firmly in its eye socket.
Still unable to commit to killing me, Loughshinny?
attributes.name: Dragon

attributes.content: Gradually, the dragon's voice overlaps with Eblana's, and eventually even its body becomes hers.
The scenery around them changes swiftly, just like that night in the ruins with Labhréathach.
I just... don't know.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: What exactly do you want?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: You deceived me, and lied to so many, all for what? For the city to be buried alongside you? To become the next legendary King Gaeil?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: I never lied to you.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: And why should I believe you now?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: What exactly is Na Saoirsí to you? What about Tara?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: I had always believed we shared the same dream. So why do they seem completely different now?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Or will dreams eventually become a card for you to play in your mad pursuit of power? One that you'll inevitably grow bored of, just like...
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Just like Loughshinny back in County Hillock?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: County Hillock?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: I saw no desire to return to me in your eyes back then, only relief. Was I mistaken?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Though I—indeed. I was truly sick of it back in County Hillock.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: With my flames, I can mold anything I want into any shape I want. Everything except my reflection in the mirror.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: No matter how large a blaze I stoked, she wouldn't change one bit.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: ...Because you've never burned her directly.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Because I've never burned you directly.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: I've only ever waited. I've always been waiting. Waiting for you to give me an answer.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: An answer?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: —What about you, Loughshinny? What do you want?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Yes, it's good that your blood and your upbringing have you carry yourself high, but if you want for nothing, then what sort of position am I meant to leave by my side for you?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Go on. This is your wish on a snowy night... I'll let you aspire as grand as you want.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: True, you never used your flames on me, but only because you had other tools more suited for the task. Fear, duty, guilt, sympathy...
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: You've never asked me directly to change, but you've done so indirectly countless times.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: So all my attempts to guide you were useless, yet my apathy bore fruit? How terribly ironic.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Whatever the case, you've finally returned of your own will, ready to embrace a real life. That is enough.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Conspiracies, lust for power, war... Is that what you'd call a real life?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Is it not? Stories, poems, legends... Do you think those are enough to constitute a life worthy of you or I?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: ...I know, I've always been ashamed of myself. Even now I hate myself for not sharing your suffering.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: I was the one who left, forcing you to shoulder it all on your own, letting them mold you into who you are now—
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: No, Loughshinny.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Recently, I've been wondering if you're just as arrogant as I am. The only difference is that my arrogance is directed at the land, while yours is focused solely on me.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Conspiracies, lust for power, war... Why do you assume those are what shaped me?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: They have never changed me. They simply happened to take on a form I was able to wield with ease, nothing more.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: The tiniest bit of power can decide whether one lives or dies. Even more power can decide the fate of armies, and an overwhelming amount can decide the rise and fall of nations.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: But power comes to an end.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: The poets have always known this, and I think you do too. Am I wrong, Loughshinny?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Death mocks all equally, preparing a predestined end for those who crave power, ruthlessly snatching away everything they spent their whole lives chasing.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: So if you knew your path would come to naught, why did you still...?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Eblana backs away as the giant steel-forged dragon follows suit.
Is it escaping? Or trying to hide?
Loughshinny subconsciously eases her fire, but in the next moment, bites down on her lip and abruptly increases her strength, pushing Eblana forward.
Very good. At least you have learned the most fundamental thing required for a life without me.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: ...Cruelty?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Determination.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: If you have decided that this path is your life, then step forward and never look back.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: You should be telling that to the people of Na Saoirsí—
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Let me finish.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Death mocks all equally... yet I shall mock death.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: So bless me, dear sister. For I am finally about to embark on a grand adventure.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Eblana retreats again and again, the smile on her face fainter than ever.
The sensation in Loughshinny's arms of piercing through steel gradually lessens, until it feels as smooth as a stroke through a body, then as hollow as running a spear through flame—
Until an immense force like the final flash of a dying light erupts from her speartip, pulling Loughshinny towards the other side.
Ice-cold flames wrap around her body, and she suddenly realizes that she now stands at the entrance of the citadel, on Red Dragon Square, right in the middle of the fire-returning rite.

Or perhaps, the dragon skeleton she is currently entangled with merely returned to its original position, and took the chance to pull her—with her firm grip on her spear—into the core of the funeral flames.
Do you still wish to get away from me, Loughshinny?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Light shoots out from Loughshinny's spear, brighter than ever.

In a flash, she feels a burning sensation as painful as her internal organs rupturing repeatedly. The flames of life burst and fade in the center of death, again and again until her weapon can no longer stand her overloaded Arts and bursts aflame as well.
The dragon's bones crash and collide with each other, like thousands of mouths singing their separate elegies.
The flames slowly grow warmer as Eblana's figure gradually fades.
Loughshinny's lips quiver, itching to say words of farewell. In her heart, she scans every book she has read, yet is unable to recall an appropriate line.
Before she dissipates, Eblana slowly cradles Loughshinny in an embrace.
Farewell... till death do us meet again.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: I hope you enjoy my parting gift.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Parting... gift?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: The mourners in the square are completely oblivious to what is occurring within the flames.
All they see is a fire growing taller and stronger, now covering the pedestal, the coffin, the dragon sculpture, the citadel, yet continuing to ascend.
The flames distort the dragon's figure. They can no longer tell whether it is flapping its wings in flight, in a death match with some unseen foe, or crying out in anguish with its head run through.
Everyone is silent, trying to identify its posture in the firelight, but all is in vain—
Until Brigid cries out in surprise.
The fire changed color!
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: The fire changed color.
A strong wind rising up from the ground turns the sky-searing purple flames into a maelstrom, and at the bottom where the coffin lies arises a small but scorching sun.
The entire deep purple vortex seems to light up, emitting a shining yellow from the bottom to the top.
Everyone near the bonfire backs away—the flames suddenly bear warmth, nearly burning them.
The rising heat dissipates, evaporating even the stream of sorrow.
Perhaps a miracle is about to occur. This is the only thought on anyone's mind.
A miracle, one I have no choice but to accept for Tara...
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Is this the parting gift you prepared for me, Sister?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Eblana is undeniably dead. She cannot answer.
Loughshinny tries to recall their hug. Expectations met, a pinch of warmth, and cold calculation. What were the proportions of each in that embrace?
Or maybe, all those things were inseparable to Eblana.
You were right, Eblana.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: If this was your ultimate goal, if you insist on laying this bloodstained crown atop my head, then, yes.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Slán abhaile.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Until death, we shan't meet again.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: The flaming vortex exhales and dissipates.
The Red Dragon, the one who led the Tarans through the long night, steps forth from the statue's center towards the entirety of Na Saoirsí.
Her expression is blurred by flame, yet her figure is as solid as the ever-persistent life on the land.
One step, then another.
Her feet step over the coffin still burning in purple embers. There is no body within, only the familiar flame-spewing spear of The Leader.
The crowd holds their breath, and the square falls silent, as if they stand outside a hospital's delivery room, or perhaps a cemetery after the last shovel of soil has been heaped into a grave.
Only dancing flames remain, without rest.

attributes.text: I can forgive everything else you've done to me, Eblana, but not this parting gift... Never.
From past to present, your name will sink into oblivion, alongside the countless names who built Tara.
The only Red Dragon of Tara will be Loughshinny Dublinn.

attributes.content: I have returned.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: The Red Dragon who led you in the fight against Victoria, in the fight for independence and freedom—
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Loughshinny Dublinn... is back from the abyss of death.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: I died to quench the flames upon you all, but the rain of tears you shed for me extinguished that fire, allowing me to return from the abyss.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: This time, though, I will not drive you to your deaths.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Our grand undertaking is complete. Never again will there be cause for countless Tarans to offer up their lives and leave us only ruins and wailing.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: I pray with all my heart that every Taran will be able to curb their own flame—flames that came from slavery, from oppression, from humiliation, from sorrow that never died out, not for thousands of years.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: I neither need nor expect you to forget. I only hope that you can do as our ancestors did, and let those flames become your lamp.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: A lamp that first warms yourself, and then...
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: ...illuminates the path for us all. So we can truly laugh, sing, and live in our homeland.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: A bright yet gentle light.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: While the crowd is still mulling over her words, one of the residents suddenly cries out in pain.
Agh! Why is the burn on my hand suddenly hurting?
attributes.name: Sensitive Resident

attributes.content: Wait, the colors of all your lamps...
attributes.name: Sensitive Resident

attributes.content: Even my own changed colors!
attributes.name: Sensitive Resident

attributes.content: These are the lights the Red Dragon hopes you will carry to warm yourselves.
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: Purple fire belongs only to the dead, yet we unwittingly let our own flames be dyed its color through overwhelming death and loss.
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: But we mistook that fire for a blessing, and allowed ourselves to be dragged towards the abyss...
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: If the Red Dragon hadn't killed herself tonight, and we hadn't managed to return her flames, we could all have been dead by now, turned into walking corpses.
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: To extinguish the flames of death in ourselves... You said that's why she killed herself?
attributes.name: Sensitive Resident

attributes.content: The sense of guilt that had crept up on Nemos after the purple flames vanished leaves her unable to reply. She only nods slightly.
Then, she feels a sudden chill on her face.
It was a drop of water. Nemos lifts her head and looks to the distant night sky.
More look up as the damp raindrops pelt their faces, gently washing their tears away.
It is raining.
On Samhain's eve the rain falls, heavier and heavier, but the crowd still remains in the square. They wish to thank the Red Dragon for returning their lives, for separating life from death.
But the dragon tells everyone she will remain here until everyone returns home to rest.

So the people gradually disperse, and eventually even the wakemen and refugees bid goodbye to the dragon. They worry that some of the dead, who have not returned their fire yet, will gather around the ruins, although that worry is unfounded.
By the time the sun rises, no longer will there be any wandering dead on Taran soil.
Amidst sobs, Nemos bids goodbye to the dragon as well. The next day, she will wake up early to collect bricks from all over town to make a new door for Culann's workshop.
The huge square empties out, leaving only a red dragon and a nomad.
Where are you off to next, Brigid?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: ...Not sure there's anywhere to go, really. All I've ever done is pass on messages or report oncoming Catastrophes.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: I think they will replace my job though... What are they called again? 'Catastrophe Messengers'?
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: There've been less and less of us nomads anyhow, so I guess I'm glad someone'll carry on the work, at least.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: You should try contacting Rhodes Island.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Hm? What's that?
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: A pharmaceutical company. They're good people. You'll have to look for their headquarters—it's a landship.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: I'll write them a letter tomorrow, and I was hoping you could deliver it for me. I think you'll like the place.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: But for tonight... You ought to rest inside the fort. We can't have you sleeping in a tent with all this rain.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Let's head to the citadel gates first.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: The two of them slowly make their way towards the citadel.
The downpour continues, and the fire on the sculpture is nearly extinguished. Only a faint flame of indistinct color flickers in the dragon's eye sockets.
They suddenly hear a voice from behind.
Stubbornness and stupidity really are hereditary, I'm telling you.
How can someone forget their own bet?
Is there someone still in the square?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: It's that invisible brother of mine. He made a bet with me.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Invisible?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Don't turn around, Loughshinny.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: He's a wee bit awkward, that one. No fan of being seen, I'm sure.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Hah.
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: Looking at the flickering flame in the dragon's eyes, Labhréathach recalls a time centuries past. When Ailill was still a lad with a cracking voice, while his own beard had just started to sprout.
Máighréad, 'the Exquisite', was promoting everything Victorian in the royal capital, and ultimately even banned a favorite custom for Taran commoners: placing bets.
That day, Labhréathach had exploded in an argument with his mother, with an unprecedented level of rage.
Afterwards, his mother ordered him to fast and reflect, but Ailill sneaked into his brother's bedroom with a big piece of steak for him.
The brothers blew out every light in the room and merrily gorged themselves, even licking their fingers clean. 'Enough stubbornness. Soon everyone in the capital will be a Victorian.' Ailill said.
Labhréathach stroked his still-soft beard, and merely shook his head. He asked: Then why not make a bet with me? Once Mother's gone, not a soul will willingly continue pretending they're Victorian.
'Fine.' Ailill replied.
The older brother burst into laughter. 'What's on the table, then? What'd make a good wager? Why not the crown? If you win, I'll never set foot in the palace for the rest of my life.'
'No. I'll wager anything but that.'
Ailill had refused. It was I who insisted on having it my way, half as a joke, and half hungry for a gamble. I nearly put him in tears, didn't I?
Yes, yes. Because Ailill was always the type to give in. He'd definitely agree.
And so, in the end, he said: 'Alright. If you go, then never come back.'
Afterwards, I ended up leaving the palace, wandering for years as Ailill spent that time unhappy in the capital.
I heard that after losing half his men in the court, Ailill was controlled by not even Victorians, but Taran nobles speaking with Victorian accents.
You lost, Labhréathach.
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: No matter how homesick you are, you've spent far too long on this family visit.
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: Not to mention you're just a pathetic shadow cast by firelight. Man, you have your own road to walk. No more breaking promises.
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: Right, just like that, take out that purple fire from the stab wound on your chest—
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: Ugh, argh...
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: Agh—And now, return it to the dragon who walked the same path you did...
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: The Exiled King's face twists from pain, but nevertheless he extends his arm bit by bit towards the eye of the skeleton.
*cough* *cough*, argh...
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: Let's see, Ailill. Is this your blade's...
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: Can phantoms also feel pain? Can they shed tears of anguish? Or is it merely the rain dripping through him as his body fades to nothingness?
He can no longer tell.
...Or perhaps the flame of your good descendant here—
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: Labhréathach!
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Loughshinny snaps around, but there is no sign of anyone else in the square.
Only the purple fire in the red dragon's eyes. It flares up a split second, before the rain extinguishes it completely.
